text.__SUMMARY__: Russula decolorans is an edible Russula mushroom, found in groups in coniferous forests.
text.Description: The cap is convex, with a depressed centre when old, often brick-red and slippery when young. The cap grows up to 10 cm. The flesh is white and turns grey when old. It has a mild taste. The spores are pale ochre.
text.Uses: It is commonly harvested for food in Finland.
text.References:
E. Garnweidner. Mushrooms and Toadstools of Britain and Europe. Collins. 1994.
